sentences: Ta oli paljusid kordi seal käinud.
Meie pere on paljusid aastaid elanud selles majas.
context: The word 'paljusid' is the partitive plural form of the Estonian adjective 'palju', which means 'much/many'. The '-sid' ending indicates it's in the partitive case and plural number, commonly used with countable nouns to indicate quantity. This form appears when we're talking about many things or people, often as the object of a verb.
